Kayako - ticket id 60094192 // Christian Schmidt commented privately: am no longer interested in version 22. GFi must now solve the problem in version 21 with the duplicate e-mails. The error is clearly in the MailEssentails.

Kayako - ticket id 60094192 // Randall Shawver commented publicly: Dear Christian,

Thank you for contacting the GFI MailEssentials Support Team. We apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced.

We will work with our Engineering team as we have many installations on SMTP servers that are not having issues. If you wish to provide logs that were collected when the issue occurred, we can further investigate.

Best regards,
Randall Shawver
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60094192 // Andriy Rybalchenko commented publicly: Dear Christian,

Thank you for reaching out. Ticket 60078199 was closed by automation due to no response for more than a week. But do not worry, we can continue here with all the context from that ticket.

We were waiting for the logs once the issue was reproduced with the new version. Could you please confirm the current state - whether you have reproduced the issue using the new version of MailEssentials? If so, kindly provide the updated logs and a sample duplicated email so we can proceed with further analysis.

Best regards,
Andriy Rybalchenko
GFI - MailEssentials Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60094192 // Christian Schmidt commented privately: We installed the update to version 22 on Friday. In short, it is a disaster. Apparently the SMTP supplied with the update was not implemented correctly.
E-mails were no longer forwarded to Kerio.
We had to restore a backup to get everything running again.
So we will not install the update in the foreseeable future. This means that the problem has to be solved by GFI.

In addition, your Atlas Ki is a disater.
